statements: SELECT * FROM Discussions WHERE student_id = 1;
SELECT discussion_topic, participation_score FROM Discussions WHERE interaction_count > 10;
SELECT * FROM Discussions WHERE discussion_id = 3;
SELECT student_id, interaction_count FROM Discussions WHERE participation_score > 8.5;
SELECT discussion_topic, participation_score, interaction_count FROM Discussions WHERE student_id = 2;
SELECT discussion_topic, participation_score FROM Discussions WHERE student_id = 123 ORDER BY interaction_count DESC;
SELECT * FROM Discussions WHERE participation_score > 80 AND discussion_topic LIKE '%database%' ORDER BY student_id ASC;
SELECT student_id, AVG(participation_score) AS avg_participation_score FROM Discussions GROUP BY student_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 2 ORDER BY avg_participation_score DESC;
SELECT AVG(interaction_count) AS avg_interaction_count, MIN(participation_score) AS min_participation_score FROM Discussions;
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_discussions FROM Discussions WHERE participation_score < (SELECT AVG(participation_score) FROM Discussions);
SELECT * FROM Students;
SELECT student_name, student_grade FROM Students WHERE student_age > 18;
SELECT discussion_topic, interaction_level FROM Discussions WHERE participation_status = true;
SELECT * FROM Discussions ORDER BY discussion_id DESC;
SELECT student_name, student_age, student_email FROM Students WHERE student_grade = 'Grade 10';
SELECT * FROM Discussions WHERE student_id = 1 AND participation_status = true ORDER BY discussion_id DESC;
SELECT discussion_topic, interaction_level FROM Discussions WHERE discussion_id IN (1, 2, 3) AND interaction_level > 2 ORDER BY interaction_level ASC, discussion_topic;
SELECT student_name, student_grade, student_email FROM Students WHERE student_age > 15 ORDER BY student_grade DESC, student_name ASC;
SELECT student_name, COUNT(discussion_id) AS num_discussions FROM Students JOIN Discussions ON Students.student_id = Discussions.student_id GROUP BY student_name ORDER BY num_discussions DESC;

SELECT student_name, AVG(interaction_level) AS avg_interaction FROM Students JOIN Discussions ON Students.student_id = Discussions.student_id GROUP BY student_name HAVING AVG(interaction_level) > 3 ORDER BY avg_interaction DESC, student_name;
SELECT * FROM Discussions;
SELECT discussion_topic, student_id FROM Discussions WHERE interaction_count > 10;
SELECT student_name, email FROM Students ORDER BY student_name DESC;
SELECT * FROM Discussions WHERE participation_status = 'Not Participated';
SELECT class_name, class_code FROM Classes WHERE class_id = 5;
SELECT * FROM Students ORDER BY student_name ASC;
SELECT student_name, email FROM Students WHERE student_id = 1;
SELECT student_name, email FROM Students WHERE email LIKE '%gmail.com%';
SELECT class_name, class_code FROM Classes ORDER BY class_id DESC;
SELECT discussion_topic, participation_status, interaction_count FROM Discussions WHERE student_id = 2;
SELECT discussion_id, student_id, discussion_topic, participation_status FROM Discussions WHERE discussion_id = 1;
SELECT * FROM Discussions WHERE student_id = 100 ORDER BY discussion_id DESC;
SELECT COUNT(*) FROM Discussions WHERE participation_status = true;
SELECT discussion_topic FROM Discussions WHERE student_id = 200 AND participation_status = false;
SELECT MAX(discussion_id) FROM Discussions;
SELECT * FROM Discussions WHERE discussion_id = 5
SELECT discussion_topic, student_id FROM Discussions WHERE participation_status = TRUE
SELECT discussion_id, discussion_topic FROM Discussions ORDER BY discussion_id DESC
SELECT * FROM Discussions WHERE student_id IN (1,3,5)
SELECT COUNT(*) AS total_discussions FROM Discussions
SELECT * FROM Discussions;
SELECT topic, TIMESTAMP FROM Discussions WHERE student_id = 1;
SELECT name, email FROM Students WHERE student_id = 2;
SELECT class_name, professor_id FROM Classes ORDER BY class_name DESC;
SELECT name, department FROM Professors WHERE department = 'Computer Science';
SELECT * FROM Discussions WHERE discussion_id = 1;
SELECT topic, timestamp FROM Discussions WHERE student_id = 2 ORDER BY timestamp DESC;
SELECT name, email FROM Students WHERE student_id = 3;
SELECT class_name, name, department FROM Classes c JOIN Professors p ON c.professor_id = p.professor_id;
SELECT d.topic, s.name, p.department FROM Discussions d JOIN Students s ON d.student_id = s.student_id JOIN Professors p ON d.student_id = p.professor_id;
